concise_definition: v. 欣赏, 感激, 领会

definitions.explanation_en: To recognize and enjoy the value, quality, or significance of something, often with a sense of gratitude or admiration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指认识到并享受某事物的价值、品质或重要性，常带有感激或钦佩之情。
definitions.example_en: She is appreciating the quiet beauty of the sunset over the lake.
definitions.example_cn: 她正欣赏着湖面上日落的宁静之美。

definitions.explanation_en: To be grateful for something, especially when it is not taken for granted or when it has been received after effort or hardship.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对某事物心怀感激，尤其当它并非理所当然，或是在付出努力或经历困难后获得时。
definitions.example_en: He is appreciating the support his family has shown during his recovery.
definitions.example_cn: 他感激家人在他康复期间给予的支持。

definitions.explanation_en: To understand or comprehend the full meaning or implications of something, often after careful thought or experience.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指经过深思或经历后，理解或领会某事物的全部含义或深远影响。
definitions.example_en: Only after living abroad for years did he begin appreciating the nuances of his own culture.
definitions.example_cn: 只有在国外生活多年后，他才开始领会自己文化的细微之处。

comparison.analysis: “Enjoying” (享受) 强调感官或情感上的愉悦体验，通常更直接、更即时，如享受美食或音乐。而 “appreciating” 更侧重于认知层面的识别与珍视，可能包含理性理解与深层情感，不一定伴随即时快感。
“Grateful” (感激的) 是形容词，描述一种心理状态，强调对他人帮助或恩惠的回报性情感。而 “appreciating” 是动词，涵盖更广的语义，包括对非人为事物（如艺术、自然）的欣赏，以及对抽象价值的理解，不局限于人际恩惠。
“Recognizing” (识别/承认) 侧重于认知上的确认或辨识，如识别出某人的面孔或某个事实的存在。而 “appreciating” 在识别的基础上进一步加入了情感评价与价值判断，意味着不仅知道，而且珍视。
